B1 a detailed study of a subject, especially in order to discover (new) information or reach a (new) understanding: scientific/medical research a research student/assistant/laboratory They are carrying out/conducting/doing some fascinating research into/on the language of dolphins.UK His researches in the field of disease prevention produced unexpected results.
More examplesFewer examplesHe has dedicated his life to scientific research.He emphasized that all the people taking part in the research were volunteers.The state of Michigan has endowed three institutes to do research for industry.I'd like to see the research that these recommendations are founded on.It took months of painstaking research to write the book.
